intro: Marsdenia gillespieae, commonly known as the Gillespie's Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
